comment: NOTCH2NLC gene is associated with a group of neurodegenerative disorders that affect the nervous system and muscles.

ZNF699 is a transcription factor gene associated with various congenital abnormalities, developmental disorders, and diseases. The exact mechanism of its function and the relationship between its variants and the listed phenotypes are not fully understood.

Note: TYROBP has been associated with an abnormal response to certain medications, which may lead to euphoric effects. However, its exact link to the symptoms and diseases mentioned is not explicitly stated in the provided associations.
ALG12 (alpha-L-fucosyltransferase) is a gene involved in the biosynthesis of glycoproteins and glycolipids.

The HADHB gene is associated with left ventricular dilatation and rigors. The exact mechanisms are not fully understood but it is thought to be related to impaired mitochondrial function in the heart.
ACP6 gene is associated with Arthropathy, Chondrocalcinosis and joint pain.
Additional information about the gene IL12A-AS1 includes its role in the immune system and its potential association with various inflammatory conditions.
COQ6 gene mutation is associated with certain types of tumors and vascular abnormalities.
Genetic disorder, rare neurological condition affecting brain development
JPHN gene mutations can lead to abnormalities in the heart's electrical conduction system, resulting in atrial flutter, sick sinus syndrome, and ventricular escape rhythm.

-Muscular dystrophy is a group of inherited disorders characterized by muscle weakness and wasting. MYH14 is associated with some types of muscular dystrophy, such as FSHD (Facioscapulohumeral Muscular Dystrophy). -Fibrodysplasia ossificans progressiva (FOP) is a rare genetic disorder that causes progressive stiffness and rigidity of the muscles, bones, and connective tissue. MYH14 mutations have been linked to FOP. -Cleidocranial dysplasia is a rare genetic disorder that affects the development of bones and teeth, including the cleid (collarbone) and cranium (skull). MYH14 mutations can be associated with this condition.

symptoms: Other complications related to high triglyceride levels and platelet activation issues
comment: This gene is associated with increased levels of platelet-activating factor, a substance involved in inflammation and blood clotting. Mutations in this gene can lead to hypertriglyceridemia, which is characterized by elevated levels of triglycerides in the blood, as well as platelet-activating factor acetylhydrolase deficiency, a rare genetic disorder that affects the body's ability to break down platelet-activating factor.

diseases: Progressive supranuclear palsy-progressive non-fluent aphasia syndrome
comment: TMEM106B is a gene associated with various neurological disorders, including Landau-Kleffner syndrome and progressive non-fluent aphasia. It has been implicated in the development of these conditions, which are characterized by difficulties with spoken word recognition and other cognitive symptoms.

The PAX8 gene is a transcription factor that plays a crucial role in the development and formation of the thyroid gland. Mutations or alterations in this gene have been linked to various thyroid-related abnormalities and diseases, including lingual thyroid (a rare congenital anomaly where the thyroid gland forms outside the normal location) and coldness of the thyroid gland.
ERLIN2 is a gene that has been linked to autosomal recessive spastic paraplegia type 25 and abnormal lumbar spine morphology.

diseases: Reduced red cell adenosine deaminase level
comment: Adenosine Deaminase (ADA) gene mutation leading to various symptoms and diseases, including Adrenal cortical sclerosis, Growth arrest lines, Abnormal erythrocyte adenosine deaminase activity, and Reduced red cell adenosine deaminase level.
-- Add any additional information or context about the gene and its relation to the diseases and symptoms--
MAGT1 gene is associated with B-cell lymphoma, Primary effusion lymphoma and secondary intestinal lymphangiectasia.

The WEE2 gene is a protein-coding gene, and it's associated with female infertility and preimplantation embryonic lethality. Oocyte maturation defect 7 (OMIM: 616943) refers to a disorder of oogenesis caused by mutations in the WEE2 gene.
Note: The gene TRANK1 has also been associated with sweet craving but it is not a direct causative link.

symptoms: Abnormal anatomic location of the heart
comment: PIEZO2 gene mutations are associated with various genetic disorders, including Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, and other conditions that affect the heart, musculoskeletal system, and nervous system.

diseases: Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract
comment: LAMC2 is a protein-coding gene that encodes lamdin 2, a component of the cytoskeleton in epithelial cells. Mutations in LAMC2 have been associated with several disorders, including aplasia/hypoplasia of the bladder, pyoderma, and abnormality of the upper respiratory tract.
DPY19L2 is associated with Globozoospermia and various forms of Spermatogenic failure.

symptoms: Low insertion of the umbilical cord
comment: DNAJB13 is a gene that has been associated with two distinct conditions: anomalous pulmonary venous return and hydrocephaly-low insertion umbilicus syndrome. The former is a condition where the pulmonary veins connect to the systemic venous system instead of the left atrium, leading to respiratory complications. The latter is a rare condition characterized by hydrocephalus (fluid accumulation in the brain) and low insertion of the umbilical cord.

The PHOX2B gene is a transcription factor that plays a crucial role in the development and function of autonomic neurons. Mutations in this gene have been associated with various disorders, including Hirschsprung's disease, autonomic dysfunction, and autonomic neuroblastoma.

diseases: Hypogonadism with low-grade mental deficiency and microcephaly
comment: PRY2 gene is associated with various reproductive and developmental abnormalities.
The FREM1 gene provides instructions for making a protein called fremin, which plays a critical role in the development of various tissues and organs during embryonic growth.
MAGED2 gene is associated with hypochloremia and increased circulating renin concentration, which may be related to various physiological processes.

SYNE1 is a gene that encodes the synecologic protein, also known as syntrophin, which plays a crucial role in maintaining the structural integrity of the neuromuscular junction and synaptic transmission. Mutations or alterations in this gene have been linked to various neurological disorders and diseases, including the ones listed above.
RELT gene is linked to hypocalcification of dental enamel.

The gene NR1H4 is associated with various symptoms and abnormalities, including pruritus (itching), particularly in the palms of the hands and soles of the feet. It also affects the digestive system and pineal gland.
The gene SLC12A3 is linked to the symptoms, abnormalities and diseases Bartter syndrome type 3 and Bruck syndrome, with abnormal sclera morphology being a common symptom.

symptoms: Decreased compound muscle action potential amplitude
Compound muscle action potential amplitude facilitation
comment: The gene SYT2 is associated with various health conditions, particularly those affecting the heart and vocal cords.
ITGB3 gene is associated with various bleeding disorders and reproductive issues.
The FOXP2 gene is a critical regulator of language development and has been strongly associated with both familial developmental dysphasia and incomprehensible speech.
The DERL1 gene is linked to Teratocarcinoma-Derived growth factor 1 and Thyroid hemiagenesis. It's also related to Global developmental delay.

The IL7 gene is involved in the regulation of the immune system. Mutations or variations in this gene have been linked to an increased susceptibility to certain fungal infections, including cryptococcal meningitis and fungal meningitis.
The ALMS1 gene is associated with a range of genetic disorders, including chronic active hepatitis.

diseases: Medial rotation of the medial malleolus
symptoms: Reduced upper to lower segment ratio
comment: The FBN1 gene is responsible for Marfan syndrome, a genetic disorder that affects the body's connective tissue. The symptoms and abnormalities associated with FBN1 include spontaneous cerebrospinal fluid leaks, depressed glabella, incisional hernia, and more.

diseases: Accumulation of lipid droplets in small-bowel enterocytes
comment: The SAR1B gene is associated with various diseases and symptoms related to lipid metabolism and vitamin abnormalities.

diseases: Short distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
comment: GNAS gene mutations are associated with multiple endocrine neoplasia type 1 (MEN1) syndrome, which affects various organs including the pancreas, parathyroid glands, and pituitary gland.
ZNF699 is a gene associated with Rombo syndrome, which presents with abnormal eyebrow morphology among other symptoms.

diseases: X-linked intellectual disability-epilepsy-progressive joint contractures-dysmorphism syndrome

comment: Mutations in MYO1H can cause a range of symptoms and diseases, including aspiration pneumonia, Niemann-Pick disease type C, and cholera.
The KDM3B gene is associated with X-linked intellectual disability and a characteristic physical feature of long ear.
PI4K2A is involved in the regulation of neurotransmitter release, and mutations or alterations in its function have been implicated in the development of akathisia and tardive dyskinesia.

symptoms: Thumb, hypoplastic, with choroid coloboma, poorly developed antihelix,and deafness

diseases: Mitochondrial complex V (atp synthase) deficiency, nuclear type 4
comment: A mitochondrial DNA mutation leading to a deficiency in ATP5V gene which is responsible for producing the enzyme that generates energy for cells.

symptoms: Elevated bronchoalveolar lavage fluid eosinophil proportion
comment: SFTPA1 gene mutations are associated with various pulmonary conditions, including Nonspecific interstitial pneumonia, intralobular and interlobular septal thickening, late onset, and clubbing. Elevated bronchoalveolar lavage fluid eosinophil proportion is also observed in individuals with SFTPA1 mutations.

Solute Carrier Family 4 Member 1 (SLC4A1) is a gene that provides instructions for making a protein called electrogenic sodium-potassium-chloride cotransporter. This protein is found in the kidneys and helps regulate the amount of acid in the urine by reabsorbing bicarbonate ions from the filtrate back into the bloodstream.

The NALCN gene provides instructions for making a protein called nav1.4, which is an alpha subunit of the voltage-gated sodium channel Nav1.4. Mutations in the NALCN gene have been associated with myopathy, congenital, with tremor (MCTD), a rare disorder characterized by muscle weakness, tremors, and other symptoms.

diseases: Abnormality of the medullary cavity of the long bones
Stenosis of the medullary cavity of the long bones
Cortical thickening of long bone diaphyses
symptoms: Abnormality of the medullary cavity of the long bones
Stenosis of the medullary cavity of the long bones
Cortical thickening of long bone diaphyses
comment: FAM111A gene is linked to various abnormalities and diseases, primarily related to bone development and calcium metabolism.
TGFBR3 gene mutation is associated with TGFBI (Transforming Growth Factor Beta Induced) corneal dystrophy, which affects the cornea and can lead to various symptoms and diseases.

The SDHD gene is associated with multiple endocrine neoplasia type 1 (MEN1), a rare disorder that affects the endocrine system. Mutations in this gene can also increase the risk of developing small intestine carcinoid tumors, which are typically benign but can cause significant symptoms.

diseases: Bone spicule pigmentation of the retina
Photoreceptor outer segment loss on macular OCT
symptoms: Bone spicule pigmentation of the retina
comment: PRCD is a rare genetic disorder that affects the retina and can cause progressive vision loss. The exact function of the PRCD gene is not fully understood, but it is thought to play a role in maintaining the health of retinal cells.

diseases: Primary angiitis of the central nervous system
comment: The ITGAV gene is associated with Primary Angiitis of the Central Nervous System (PACNS), which can cause symptoms such as Amaurosis Fugax (temporary loss of vision).
The FBN1 gene is associated with Weill-Marchesani syndrome type 2 and depressed glabella.
PKHD1 gene is associated with Proteinuria, low molecular weight, hypercalciuric nephrocalcinosis.

symptoms: Morphological abnormalities of the hepatic artery
Morphological abnormalities of the portal venous system
comment: KIF20A gene is associated with various liver abnormalities, including hypoplasia or underdevelopment of the portal vein and hyperplasia or overgrowth of the hepatic artery. It may also affect the morphology of the portal venous system.

This gene encodes for a protein called Factor XIII, which is involved in blood clotting. The association with 'Factor XIII subunit B deficiency' and 'Delayed onset bleeding' suggests that mutations or variations in this gene may lead to abnormal clotting patterns and delayed bleeding.

Note: STK11 is a tumor suppressor gene. Mutations in this gene are associated with Peutz-Jeghers syndrome (PJS), a rare genetic disorder characterized by the development of benign polyps in the gastrointestinal tract and an increased risk of certain cancers, including nasopharyngeal carcinoma.
Note: The exact relationship between VMA21 and the mentioned diseases/symptoms may require further research for confirmation.
The ANO5 gene is associated with Osteochondritis dissecans, a joint condition characterized by the chipping or cracking of cartilage and bone.

The SMO gene is associated with several congenital abnormalities and diseases, including osseous finger syndactyly, neural tube defects, skin lesions (nevus sebaceous), and seizures. The exact mechanism of how the SMO gene causes these conditions is not fully understood.
Mutations in the MYOT gene are associated with Myotilin-related myopathies, which can cause Abnormal Z disk morphology and Accumulation of muscle fiber myotilin.

The ROBO3 gene provides instructions for making a protein called robospecific receptor kinase 3. This protein plays a critical role in the development and maintenance of the nervous system, particularly in the regulation of motor neurons and muscle function.

diseases: Metabolic encephalomyopathic crises, recurrent, with rhabdomyolysis, cardiac arrhythmias, and neurodegeneration
comment: The gene TANGO2 is associated with Elevated circulating aldolase concentration, Metabolic encephalomyopathic crises, recurrent, with rhabdomyolysis, cardiac arrhythmias, and neurodegeneration.

The LMNA gene is associated with a variety of conditions, including Abnormality of complement system. The OMIM entry for Complement component C1s deficiency also mentions the association with this gene.
The AMTN gene is associated with Hypomaturation type, iia2 and hypomaturation type, iia4 Amelogenesis imperfecta subtypes.

The FEZF1 gene is responsible for encoding the forkhead box E1 (FoxE1) transcription factor. Mutations in this gene have been associated with X-linked adrenal hypoplasia congenita and hypogonadotropic hypogonadism, which involve decreased circulating luteinizing hormone levels.

Note: IL12A-AS1 is a long non-coding RNA (lncRNA) that has been associated with various biological processes. In the context of Intracranial Hypertension (ICH), research suggests that alterations in lncRNA expression, including IL12A-AS1, may contribute to the development and progression of ICH.

The gene POMK (Phosphatase and Tensin Homolog Deleted on Chromosome 10) is linked to intellectual disability, borderline intellectual functioning, and the Blepharophimosis-ptosis-esotropia-syndactyly-short stature syndrome.

symptoms: Reduced circulating aromatic L-amino acid decarboxylase activity
comment: The DDB1 gene is associated with Disseminated Denmatocytosis with Deficiency (DDC), a rare genetic disorder. The gene is involved in DNA repair and is located on chromosome 2p12.
The STN1 gene is associated with immunodeficiency 73C, a disorder characterized by defective neutrophil chemotaxis and hypogammaglobulinemia.

The Barttin protein is a subunit of the ATP-sensitive potassium channel, which plays a critical role in regulating ion transport and maintaining proper fluid balance in the kidneys. Mutations in the ABCC8 gene can lead to Bartter syndrome type 4A, characterized by renal salt wasting, sensorineural deafness, and hypokalemic alkalosis.

diseases: congenital anomalies of kidney and urinary tract
comment: HRURF is a gene associated with congenital anomalies and diseases. It plays a role in the development of certain organs and tissues.

diseases: Abnormality of the first metatarsal bone
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the hallux
comment: ACVR1 is a gene that encodes for the activin receptor type-1, which plays a crucial role in bone development and growth. Mutations in this gene have been associated with various skeletal abnormalities and diseases.

diseases: Brachycephaly, deafness, cataract, microstomia, and mental retardation
Cleft palate, cardiac defect, genital anomalies, and ectrodactyly
Hypertelorism, preauricular sinus, punctal pits, and deafness
comment: NEXMIF gene mutation is associated with various genetic disorders.

gene: Multiple genes associated with Talipes equinovarus (Clubfoot)
diseases: Autosomal dominant adult-onset proximal spinal muscular atrophy
Congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to cytochrome P450 oxidoreductase deficiency
Vertebral, cardiac, renal, and limb defects syndrome 2
Midface hypoplasia, hearing impairment, elliptocytosis, and nephrocalcinosis
Congenital muscular dystrophy due to LMNA mutation
Neurodevelopmental disorder with seizures and nonepileptic hyperkinetic movements
Vertebral, cardiac, renal, and limb defects syndrome 1
comment: Multiple genetic mutations can cause Talipes equinovarus (Clubfoot) and associated disorders. The specific gene(s) involved can vary depending on the individual case.

gene: Multiple genes associated with Hypernasal speech. Some of these include: PKP2, COL5A1, FBN1, LAMB2, LAMC2, ZNF337B,
comment: Note: Multiple genes can be associated with the symptoms and diseases listed above.
Note: ORPHA is a synonym for HPO (Human Phenotype Ontology) entries.

Oligohydramnios is a condition characterized by a decrease in the amount of amniotic fluid surrounding the fetus during pregnancy. The gene RNU4ATAC has been linked to this condition, as well as several other related diseases and abnormalities, including Renal tubular dysgenesis, Meckel syndrome, Megacystis-microcolon-intestinal hypoperistalsis syndrome 4 and 5, and Megacystis-microcolon-intestinal hypoperistalsis syndrome 1.
The IL17F gene is associated with Abnormal lip morphology and Phlebectasia of lips.
CLIC2 is a gene associated with X-linked intellectual disability and cardiomegaly, which can lead to congestive heart failure syndrome.

symptoms: Elevated bronchoalveolar lavage fluid neutrophil proportion
comment: The gene SFTPA2 is associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) and other pulmonary diseases. It is also known as the surfactant protein A2 gene.
BMPR1A mutation is associated with Overgrowth and Dysplasia epiphysealis hemimelica.

SCNN1G is a gene that provides instructions for making one of the two alpha subunits of the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) protein. Mutations in the SCNN1G gene are associated with Staphylococcal necrotizing pneumonia, which is a severe and potentially life-threatening form of pneumonia caused by Staphylococcus aureus bacteria.
The gene JPH2 is associated with the development of joint hypermobility and its related disorders. It is linked to Harrod syndrome, Hypertrichosis cubiti, and Temtamy syndrome.

PGAP1 is a gene associated with isolated lissencephaly type 1, characterized by an absence of normal convolutions in the brain. It has been linked to enlarged sylvian cisterns, which are abnormal fluid-filled spaces in the brain.

diseases: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe
Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd toe
Abnormal size of the dental root
comment: BCOR (Brahma-Box C-like coiled-coil protein) gene mutation is linked to various developmental and skeletal abnormalities.

GDF6 is a gene that encodes a protein involved in the regulation of axon guidance and neuronal migration. Mutations in this gene have been associated with various neurological disorders, including ataxia-oculomotor apraxia type 1, cognitive impairment, motion sickness, and congenital clasped thumbs.

PKD1 is a gene that encodes for polycystin-1, a protein involved in maintaining fluid balance within the kidneys. Mutations in this gene can lead to renal tubular dysfunction and kidney damage, as seen in Danubian endemic familial nephropathy.
Associated with Sprengel deformity, a congenital deformity of the shoulder blade

The SMAD4 gene is a tumor suppressor gene that plays a crucial role in the regulation of cell growth and differentiation. Mutations or deletions of this gene have been linked to an increased risk of developing gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GISTs) and desmoid tumors, which can cause intestinal obstruction among other symptoms.
Kenny-Caffey syndrome is also associated with the same gene but as autosomal recessive type

Note: RNU7-1 is a gene that has been associated with Arrhinencephaly and Fetal Akinesia Syndrome. However, more research is needed to fully understand the relationship between this gene and these conditions.
SLC2A1 is a gene associated with various symptoms, abnormalities, and diseases.

diseases: Congenital disorder of glycosylation, type IIc
symptoms: Abnormal serum insulin-like growth factor 1 level
comment: This gene is associated with Congenital disorder of glycosylation, type IIc and abnormal serum insulin-like growth factor 1 level.

Mutations in the NRAS gene can lead to various abnormalities and diseases, including Abnormal choroid plexus morphology, Linear nevus sebaceous, Numerous congenital melanocytic nevi, and Decreased T cell apoptosis. These conditions are often associated with mutations in the NRAS gene.
Note: Equinovarus deformity is a characteristic feature of this condition.

The gene SYT1 is associated with various neurological disorders, including epilepsy and abnormal EEG patterns. The symptoms listed are related to focal seizures and EEG abnormalities, while the abnormal location of the eyebrow is a physical manifestation of the underlying genetic condition.

diseases: Atrial septal defect-atrioventricular conduction defects syndrome
comment: Related to Holt-Oram syndrome and other abnormalities in the heart.

POMK gene mutations have been associated with various neurodevelopmental disorders, including intellectual disability and borderline personality disorder. The gene is involved in regulating cell growth and differentiation, particularly in the brain. Mutations in POMK can lead to abnormal development of the cerebellum, which may result in symptoms such as fusion of the cerebellar hemispheres. Additionally, iris morphology abnormalities have been reported in individuals with POMK mutations.

gene: Multiple genes are associated with coronary artery atherosclerosis.
diseases: Atherosclerosis, premature, with deafness, nephropathy, diabetes mellitus,photomyoclonus, and degenerative neurologic disease

Expanded metacarpals with widened medullary cavities
Recurrent viral upper respiratory tract infections

Expanded metatarsals with widened medullary cavities
comment: IFIH1 gene is associated with a wide range of symptoms and diseases, including autoimmune disorders, osteodystrophies, gastrointestinal disorders, and more.
GRHPR gene is associated with several diseases and symptoms, particularly related to kidney function and urinary system.
PTEN gene mutation is associated with multiple types of tumors and abnormalities, particularly in the endocrine system.

CCNQ is associated with ZFD gene mutation, which can cause a range of symptoms and abnormalities including syringomyelia, labial hypoplasia, valvular pulmonary stenosis and abnormal pulmonary valve physiology.

diseases: Neurodevelopmental disorder with nonspecific brain abnormalities and with or without seizures

The gene VPS33A is linked to Mucopolysaccharidosis Type Vii, a rare genetic disorder characterized by the accumulation of glycosaminoglycans in the body, leading to various symptoms and abnormalities.
Genetic disorder caused by deficiency in glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor biosynthesis.
The NOTCH2NLC gene mutation is associated with cognitive impairment.

diseases: Cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy, and vestibular areflexia syndrome

comment: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome Type I (EDS-I) is a mild form of the disease. It affects about 1 in every 5,000 people and usually has no noticeable symptoms until later in life.
The ARID2 gene is associated with various physical abnormalities and diseases, including papillary thyroid carcinoma, recurrent upper respiratory tract infections, and hypoplastic nails.
C14orf39 is a gene associated with ovarian development and function.
associated with autosomal recessive disorder 34.
NCF1 gene is linked to the symptoms, abnormalities and diseases listed above.
Genetic disorder affecting brain development
The KLLN gene is associated with renal cell carcinoma.
The CACNA1D gene is associated with abnormal muscle physiology and increased heart rate variability.
The PAX7 gene is linked to Antley-Bixler syndrome, a rare genetic disorder characterized by abnormalities in the face and skull.

diseases: Progressive spondyloepimetaphyseal dysplasia-short stature-short fourth metatarsals-intellectual disability syndrome
comment: The gene RSPRY1 is linked to Progressive spondyloepimetaphyseal dysplasia-short stature-short fourth metatarsals-intellectual disability syndrome. Toe clinodactyly is also mentioned in the provided associations.
MACR gene is associated with Macrotia, Intellectual developmental disorder, Galloway-Mowat syndrome and Alopecia-intellectual disability syndrome.
Ubiquitin protein ligase E3-activating enzyme 1

The HOGA1 gene provides instructions for making a protein called hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT). The HGPRT enzyme plays a crucial role in the purine metabolism pathway. Mutations in the HOGA1 gene lead to impaired HGPRT activity, resulting in the accumulation of toxic compounds that can cause kidney damage and the formation of kidney stones.
This gene is associated with a group of conditions that affect the skin and may also be related to epilepsy.

The PCSK9 gene plays a critical role in cholesterol metabolism. It encodes for a protein that regulates the number of LDL receptors on the surface of liver cells, which are responsible for removing low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol from the bloodstream.
POGLUT1 is a gene associated with several rare genetic disorders that affect the skin and other organs.
The gene DNAH5 is associated with Combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 46 (PET117) and Primary ciliary dyskinesia.

diseases: Abnormality of the dorsal column of the spinal cord
symptoms: Abnormality of the dorsal column of the spinal cord
comment: Association with neurological disorders

The STRC gene is associated with male infertility and abnormal sperm tail morphology. Mutations in this gene have been linked to teratozoospermia, a condition characterized by the presence of abnormally shaped sperm.

RYR3 is a gene that encodes for the ryanodine receptor 3, which plays a critical role in calcium release from the sarcoplasmic reticulum in muscle cells. Mutations in this gene have been linked to various diseases and symptoms, including Duchenne muscular dystrophy, tooth abnormalities, echogenic intracardiac focus, and toe joint contracture.
Mutations in the ARID1A gene have been associated with XPC syndrome

The CARD11 gene provides instructions for making a protein that plays a crucial role in the functioning of the immune system, particularly in the development and activation of certain immune cells called T cells.
Note: The information provided is based on the given associations and may not be exhaustive or up-to-date. It's always best to consult a medical professional for accurate information.
FAM111B is a gene associated with various symptoms, abnormalities and diseases. The exact function of the FAM111B protein is not yet fully understood.

symptoms: Abnormalities of skin, nails, and hair growth
comment: CARMIL2 is a gene that has been linked to Chronic Mucocutaneous Candidiasis (CMC), a rare autoimmune disorder characterized by recurring fungal infections.

diseases: Epilepsy, focal, with speech disorder and with or without mental retardation
Developmental and epileptic encephalopathy with spike-wave activation in sleep
comment: Note that the gene SRPX2 is linked to multiple diseases and symptoms. The microduplication Xp11.22p11.23 syndrome is also associated with the same gene.
The SDHD gene is associated with a higher risk of developing intestinal carcinoid, a type of cancer that originates in the digestive system.
The gene RNU4ATAC is linked to muscle stiffness and postorgasmic illness syndrome.

diseases: Shortening of all phalanges of fingers
Cone-shaped epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
symptoms: Abnormalities in the shape and structure of bones
comment: // The TRPS1 gene is linked to several genetic disorders that affect bone growth and development.
The HSD10 gene is associated with Nasogastric tube feeding in infancy and HSD10 disease. The exact mechanism of how this gene causes the symptoms and abnormalities is not fully understood.
FLCN gene mutation is associated with familial spontaneous pneumothorax.
Phosphoglycerate dehydrogenase (PHGDH) deficiency is the primary cause of hypoargininemia, a rare genetic disorder that affects amino acid metabolism.
Note: RNU4ATAC is a pseudogene but is associated with a specific type of nemaline myopathy. The actual gene responsible for the condition is not well defined.

The COL7A1 gene provides instructions for making a protein called collagen VII, which is an important component of the dermal layer. Mutations in this gene can lead to familial reactive perforating collagenosis (FRPC), a rare skin disorder characterized by recurring skin lesions and scarring.

diseases: Adrenocortical carcinoma with pure aldosterone hypersecretion
comment: Note: IL12A is associated with multiple conditions, but the symptoms and diseases listed above are directly linked to headache.

symptoms: Impaired sensitivity to thyroid stimulating hormone
comment: TSHR is a transmembrane receptor that plays a crucial role in the regulation of thyroid function. Mutations or abnormalities in this gene can lead to various thyroid-related disorders.

diseases: Dysmorphism-short stature-deafness-difference of sex development syndrome
comment: This gene is associated with the STAC3 gene variant. The association was found in two studies, which identified a link between this variant and an increased risk of submucous cleft soft palate and other symptoms.

The MBL2 gene provides instructions for making a protein called mannose-binding lectin. This protein plays a key role in the immune system, helping to defend against infections by marking them for destruction. Mutations in the MBL2 gene have been associated with an increased risk of recurrent meningococcal disease.

The TRPV3 gene provides instructions for making a protein called transient receptor potential vanilloid 3. This protein is found on the surface of sensory nerve cells and helps to detect chemical irritants, such as those found in spicy foods.

KLF4-LIKE TRANSCRIPTION FACTOR 4 (KLLN) is a gene that has been associated with melanoma, a type of skin cancer. The associations between KLLN and melanoma are based on the following references: HP:Melanoma, OMIM:Melanoma, cutaneous malignant, susceptibility to, 10 and HP:Melanoma, OMIM:Melanoma, cutaneous malignant, susceptibility to, 9.
The GATA5 gene has been linked to an increased risk of thrombophilia and Mntrier disease, a rare disorder characterized by excessive gastric acid production.

diseases: Decreased specific antibody response to protein vaccine
symptoms: Hemophagocytosis (a condition characterized by the abnormal consumption of blood cells)
comment: CBL is a gene that encodes for an E3 ubiquitin ligase, which plays a role in regulating the degradation of proteins. Mutations in the CBL gene have been associated with Hepatic hemophagocytosis and Decreased specific antibody response to protein vaccine.
IDH1 gene is associated with various symptoms, abnormalities, and diseases. However, the specific symptom 'Symptoms' is not documented in the provided associations.

diseases: Abnormal carboxylic acid concentrations in CSF
Alpha-ketoglutarate accumulation in urine and CSF
comment: The SLC13A3 gene is involved in the transport of amino acids across cell membranes. Mutations or variations in this gene can lead to abnormal levels of certain amino acids in the body, including N-acetylaspartic acid, succinate, and alpha-ketoglutarate.
TRAPPC11 gene is associated with glucocorticoid deficiency 3.
TAPT1 is a gene associated with a condition that affects the development and structure of bones in the fetus, leading to various abnormalities and increased risk of fractures.
The ABCA4 gene is a transmembrane transporter involved in cholesterol efflux and absorption. Mutations in this gene can lead to various diseases, including those listed above.

STAT1 is a gene that plays a crucial role in the immune system. Mutations or variations in this gene have been associated with impaired immune function and an increased susceptibility to infections, such as recurrent mycobacterium avium complex (MAC) infections. This can lead to Immunodeficiency 31A, which is characterized by severe immunological deficiencies.
The association suggests that SLC34A2 gene may be linked to primary pulmonary hypoplasia and increased circulating surfactant protein levels.
The NPC2 gene is associated with various symptoms, abnormalities, and diseases related to cellular dysfunction and immune system regulation.

CCT5 is a gene associated with various symptoms and diseases. It is linked to decreased circulating apolipoprotein B concentration, foot osteomyelitis, and decreased circulating apolipoprotein concentration.

diseases: Juvenile-onset diabetes mellitus-central and peripheral neurodegeneration syndrome
comment: The gene BDS2 is linked to Diabetes mellitus, Juvenile-onset diabetes mellitus-central and peripheral neurodegeneration syndrome and Bardet-biedl Syndrome 2. It also has a relation with hypoglycemic agent therapy.

symptoms: Increased CD8+ TEMRA T cell proportion
Abnormal naive CD8 T cell proportion
Decreased naive CD8 T cell proportion
Increased CD8+ memory T cell proportion

comment: Low urinary cyclic AMP response to PTH administration

SFTPB (surfactant protein B) is a gene that encodes for a protein involved in lung function. Mutations or deficiencies in this gene have been associated with pulmonary opacity and neonatal acute respiratory distress syndrome.

The ACTR4 gene is also known as WNT5A and is involved in the development of various tissues and organs, including bone, cartilage, and connective tissue. Mutations in this gene have been associated with Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber syndrome and Fibrodysplasia ossificans progressive.

diseases: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd finger
symptoms: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd finger
Abnormalities in toe formation and function
comment: NEDD4L is a gene associated with various abnormalities, including contractures and syndactyly.
EFEMP1 gene mutations are associated with LTV1, a condition characterized by mottled pigmentation, pigment incontinence, and acrokeratosis.

diseases: Severe combined immunodeficiency due to FOXN1 deficiency
T-CELL IMMUNODEFICIENCY, CONGENITAL ALOPECIA, AND NAIL DYSTROPHY
comment: The FOXN1 gene is associated with Nail pits, and has been linked to several diseases including Severe combined immunodeficiency due to FOXN1 deficiency, T-CELL IMMUNODEFICIENCY, CONGENITAL ALOPECIA, AND NAIL DYSTROPHY, Ichthyosis with erythrokeratoderma, and Hypotrichosis 8.
TRPV3 is a gene associated with Palmoplantar keratoderma, nonepidermolytic, focal 2 and Erythrokeratodermia variabilis et progressiva 1.

The MYMX gene provides instructions for making a protein called myosin X, which is involved in the movement of muscles and tissues. Mutations in this gene have been associated with ulnar deviation of the finger.
HMBS gene mutation is associated with Porphyria Cutanea Tarda (PCT), a form of acute intermittent porphyria.

The TRPV4 gene is associated with Rippling Muscle Disease 1, which presents with exercise-induced muscle stiffness. However, please note that this information is based on the given associations and might not be exhaustive or up-to-date.
The PRKAR1A gene is associated with Myxoid subcutaneous tumors and Carney complex, type 1.
Association with Bone spicule pigmentation of the retina, Night blindness, Congenital stationary, autosomal dominant 1 and PRCD

diseases: Abnormal hair, joint laxity, and developmental delay
Mitochondrial DNA-related cardiomyopathy and hearing loss

comment: The TSEN54 gene is associated with Progressive Microcephaly and Epileptic Encephalopathy, Early Infantile

The gene ATP7A is associated with Hereditary bullous dystrophy, macular type and Atrichia. It is a copper-transporting P-type ATPase that plays a crucial role in maintaining normal skin pigmentation and hair growth.
These genes have been found to contribute to the development of these diseases through various mechanisms, including protein misfolding, neuronal damage, and impaired neurotransmission.
MID1 gene is associated with a range of developmental abnormalities and diseases, including the mentioned conditions.
The ZNF384 gene is associated with a range of congenital disorders, including the listed conditions in CTU2.
ADAMTS19 is a gene that has been linked to thymic carcinoma, pericardial and diaphragmatic defects, and chest pain.

The gene PNP is associated with several diseases and abnormalities, including abnormal circulating purine concentrations, humoral immunodeficiency, and unusual gastrointestinal infections. It is also related to abnormalities in B cell physiology and increased levels of inosine and guanosine in the urine.
HP:Typified by age-related disease onset

SNORD116 is a small nucleolar RNA and its mutations have been associated with several disorders, including Fanconi renotubular syndrome 5, Epiphyseal dysplasia, multiple, 5, and Polydactyly, postaxial, type A8. Genu valgum (knock-knee) is also a common feature in these conditions.
Mutations in the NR2F1 gene are associated with the genetic disorder Naxos syndrome, which is characterized by hypoplastic external genitalia, fingernail dysplasia, and absent or rudimentary uvula.

diseases: Broad distal phalanx of the thumb
Broad distal phalanx of the hallux
comment: HOXD13 gene mutations are associated with various limb abnormalities, including broad distal phalanges and toe hypoplasia. Brachydactyly type D is a specific form of shortening of the fingers.
This gene is associated with several disorders, including developmental delays and specific physical abnormalities.

symptoms: Abnormal morphology of the limbic system

Broad proximal phalanx of the hallux
comment: FGFR2 stands for Fibroblast Growth Factor Receptor 2. It is a gene that provides instructions for making a protein called fibroblast growth factor receptor 2. Mutations in the FGFR2 gene can lead to various developmental disorders and diseases.

The HMGCR gene encodes the enzyme hydroxymethylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase, which is involved in the biosynthesis of heme. Mutations in this gene lead to defects in heme production, resulting in the accumulation of intermediate compounds that cause the symptoms and diseases associated with porphyrias.

The SLC12A3 gene encodes for the thiazide-sensitive sodium-chloride cotransporter, which is involved in sodium and chloride reabsorption in the kidneys. Mutations or alterations in this gene have been associated with various diseases and symptoms listed above.
These genes are associated with abnormal circulating luteinizing hormone concentrations and specific genetic disorders, including sex reversal and spermatogenic failure.
The TYR gene is responsible for the production of the enzyme tyrosinase, which plays a crucial role in the breakdown of the amino acid tyrosine.

diseases: Mirror movements 1 and/or agenesis of the corpus callosum
comment: The GNB12 gene is associated with various symptoms and diseases, including infantile onset and severe neurological abnormalities.
ZNF469 is a zinc finger protein that has been associated with atypical scarring of the skin.

diseases: Reduced C27 3beta-HSD activity in cultured fibroblasts
comment: HSD3B7 is a gene that has been linked to reduced 3-beta-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase (3beta-HSD) activity, neonatal cholestatic liver disease, and giant cell hepatitis.
RTL1 gene mutations are associated with these conditions.

diseases: Congenital infiltrating lipomatosis of the face
comment: ZMPSTE24 is a gene that has been linked to several genetic disorders, including temporomandibular joint ankylosis, isolated congenital hypoglossia/aglossia, and congenital infiltrating lipomatosis of the face. These conditions are characterized by abnormalities in the development of the jaw, tongue, and facial tissues.
The SHANK3 gene is associated with the mentioned disorders and symptoms.

The TOE1 gene is associated with ovotesticular disorder of sex development (OT-DSD), a condition where an individual has both ovarian and testicular tissue. Abnormalities in the TOE1 gene can lead to various symptoms, including abnormal scrotal rugation.

diseases: Neurodevelopmental disorder with cerebral atrophy and variable facial dysmorphism
Neurodevelopmental disorder with dysmorphic facies and distal limb anomalies
